title.value: Causal Inference in Gene Regulatory Networks with GFlowNet: Towards Scalability in Large Systems
title.justification: This is the title of the paper as stated at the beginning of the document.
title.quote:
Causal Inference in Gene Regulatory Networks
with GFlowNet: Towards Scalability in Large Systems

extractions.description: The paper introduces Swift-DynGFN, a novel framework aimed at improving causal structure learning in Gene Regulatory Networks (GRNs) while addressing scalability challenges. The framework enhances the architecture of Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNet) to allow for better parallelization and computational efficiency. Empirical evaluations using real single-cell RNA velocity and synthetic datasets demonstrate the advancements in capturing causal structures in GRNs and scalability for larger systems.

type.justification: The paper contains experimental results and empirical evaluations on datasets, which indicates that it is an empirical study.
type.quote: Empirical evaluations using real single-cell RNA velocity and synthetic datasets demonstrate the advancements in capturing causal structures in GRNs and scalability for larger systems.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on understanding gene interactions and causal relationships in Gene Regulatory Networks (GRNs), which falls under the field of bioinformatics.
name.quote: Understanding causal relationships within Gene Regulatory Networks (GRNs) is essential for unraveling the gene interactions in cellular processes.

name.justification: The paper aims to enhance causal structure learning, which is a key aspect of causal inference.
name.quote: We introduce Swift-DynGFN as a novel framework that enhances causal structure learning in GRNs while addressing scalability concerns.

name.justification: The paper extends GFlowNet to improve causal structure learning in GRNs, indicating its focus on Generative Flow Networks.
name.quote: Specifically, Swift-DynGFN exploits gene-wise independence to boost parallelization and to lower computational cost.

name.justification: The paper discusses GFlowNet and its role in modeling intricate distributions over cyclic structures.
name.quote: GFlowNet plays a critical role in the work to model intricate distributions over cyclic structures.

is_contributed.justification: GFlowNet was not introduced in this paper but is a foundational model that Swift-DynGFN builds upon.
is_contributed.quote: Besides, GFlowNet plays a critical role in the work to model intricate distributions over cyclic structures. However, the scalability is still one restriction of their work on larger systems.

is_executed.justification: The experiments utilizing GFlowNet were executed, as indicated by the empirical evaluations mentioned in the paper.
is_executed.quote: Experiments on real single-cell RNA velocity and synthetic GRN datasets showcase the advancement in learning causal structure in GRNs and scalability in larger systems.

is_compared.justification: GFlowNet's performance is compared to other models like DynGFN, DynBCD, and DynDiBS for benchmarking.
is_compared.quote: We compare our method to DynGFN, DynBCD, and DynDiBS, reported in DynGFN paper Atanackovic et al. [2023].

referenced_paper_title.value: Flow Network based Generative Models for Non-Iterative Diverse Candidate Generation
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the foundational paper of GFlowNet as mentioned in the document.
referenced_paper_title.quote: the incorporation with Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets) [Bengio et al., 2021, 2023] sheds light on solving the first limitation.

name.justification: DynGFN is used as a comparative baseline in the experiments.
name.quote: We compare our method to DynGFN, DynBCD, and DynDiBS, reported in DynGFN paper Atanackovic et al. [2023].

is_contributed.justification: DynGFN is not an original contribution of this paper but is used for comparison.
is_contributed.quote: We compare our method to DynGFN, DynBCD, and DynDiBS, reported in DynGFN paper Atanackovic et al. [2023].

is_executed.justification: DynGFN was executed as part of the comparative experiments.
is_executed.quote: We compare our method to DynGFN, DynBCD, and DynDiBS, reported in DynGFN paper Atanackovic et al. [2023].

is_compared.justification: DynGFN is explicitly compared against the proposed Swift-DynGFN for benchmarking.
is_compared.quote: We compare our method to DynGFN, DynBCD, and DynDiBS, reported in DynGFN paper Atanackovic et al. [2023].

referenced_paper_title.value: Generalizing RNA velocity to transient cell states through dynamical modeling
referenced_paper_title.justification: The single-cell RNA velocity dataset is referenced to Bergen et al. [2020] in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In estimating the change rate in gene expression by leveraging RNA velocity Bergen et al. [2020], x and dx align to gene expression levels and velocity of changes in gene expression, respectively.
